General Fever Bacterial infections Meningitis Otitis Other clinical features: osteomyelitis, bronchopneumonia, pyodermitis, urinary tract infection, arthritis

comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing

Other clinical features: Recurrent attacks of otitis media before the age of three. In addition, patient had frequent pyogenic infecions of the upper respiratory tract during early childhood. Between 5 and 8 years of age patient had more than 20 episodes of rash on face, forearms and hands.

consequence.term: deletion in the exon 18 leading to a premature stop codon

comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing

Bacterial infections Meningitis Pneumonia Other clinical features: Patient developed two episodes of meningococcal meningitis at 5 and 6 years of age. She suffered from episodes of pneumonia an average of two or three times per year when aged 8 - 16 years and was admitted to hospital. These infections were followed by a rash described as erythema gyratum perstans and Sweet syndrome. 1985-1992 (article published 1992) she had been entirely well. She has given birth to three normal children.

consequence.term: deletion in the exon 22,23 leading to a premature stop codon of pedigree:Patient's parents and paternal
